terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Chemistry, Wayne State University, United States

description: Glutathionylation is an important post-translational modification and developing tools to identify which cysteine residues on proteins are glutathionylated in response to different physiological conditions is necessary. This project utilizes an approach consisting of azido-glutathione, a single purified protein, and an oxidant to form disulfide bonds between the azide modified glutathione and the cysteine residues of the protein. After this the reaction is quenched with iodoacetamide, subjected to a click reaction with a chemically cleavable alkyne conjugated biotin, and digested with trypsin. These peptide fragments are eluted from streptavidin beads and subjected to LC-MS/MS to determine which cysteine residues are glutathionylated in-vitro.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Human, purified protein, glutathionylation, cysteine, click chemistry

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Munkanatta Godage DNP, VanHecke GC, Samarasinghe KTG, Feng HZ, Hiske M, Holcomb J, Yang Z, Jin JP, Chung CS, Ahn YH. SMYD2 glutathionylation contributes to degradation of sarcomeric proteins. Nat Commun. 2018 9(1):4341

title: In-vitro glutathionylation of SMYD2
